description:
Insolvency proceedings (other debtors)

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
52411 Statistics on filed insolvency proceedings

Definition:
The purpose of judicial insolvency proceedings is to
distribute the property of illiquid or overindebted debtors
among the group of creditors and to achieve rehabilitation
where possible. Insolvency law differentiates between normal
and simplified insolvency proceedings. Enterprises, formerly
self-employed persons with an unclear financial situation,
members of larger partnerships, deceased persons' estates
and joint marital property are typically subject to normal
insolvency proceedings, while consumers and formerly
self-employed persons with a clear financial situation are
subject to simplified proceedings which are also called
consumer insolvency proceedings.


© Statistisches Bundesamt, Wiesbaden 2017
name: Insolvency proceedings (other debtors)
